article.headline: Idaho 76, Montana St. 67
article.story: MOSCOW, Idaho -- Deremy Geiger hit four 3-pointers on his way to a season high 23 points as Idaho beat Montana State 76-67 Saturday night. Kyle Barone and Landon Tatum added 11 points apiece, and Idaho (3-2) held Montana State well below its season average of 81 points per game. Montana State (2-3) was led by Rod Singleton with 17 points to go along with three steals. Mohammed Fall added 12 points. With two minutes remaining, Christian Moon hit back to back 3-pointers and Rod Singleton hit another 3 to cut the lead to seven, 74-67, but the Bobcats were forced to foul and went on to lose by nine points. Idaho shot 52 percent from the field, on 24 of 46 shooting, while the Bobcats shot 38.7 percent for the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
